Package control

Class ActionPoints

java.lang.Object
control.ActionPoints
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<ActionPoints>
public class ActionPoints extends Object implements Comparable<ActionPoints>
This class represents a pair of action list and points. It is used by AI to evaluate and compare different moves based on their calculated points. The points represent values such as the length of a line of pawns. The action list represents the actions to be executed to achieve a goal, like extending a line or breaking an opponent's line.

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(ActionPoints actionPoints)
      Compares this object with the specified object for order. This helps to sort actions based on their points in descending order, from the action with the most points to the one with the least points.
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<ActionPoints>
      Parameters:
      actionPoints - the action points to compare with.
      Returns:
      a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as this object has more points, equal points, or fewer points than the specified object.
